runs.comm: some swing away and the batsman pushes out to the covers and they think about charging  through
lets that one go down the channel, still the encouraging rise from the track, but he shoulders arms
comes forward, looking to clip through on the front foot to midwicket, instead the edge pings off down past first slip to the fence, defeating the chasing Gillespie
comes down on the front foot and drives out in front of mid on
driven straight back past the bowler
pushed out to mid off
pushes hard, but back into the track, back towards Gillespie as the ball comes in full
outside off and that's ugly I'm afraid, Wright going for the pull and the ball goes out towards the covers with hardly any power
on off, pushed out towards short midwicket
outside off, Wright can't time this one either, a flat-bat pull out towards mid on
the ball threatens to pop up to short midwicket as once again it comes in on a good length
a huge throat-scorching roar as Gillespie thinks Wright has been trapped in front, but perhaps just outside the line. Too close to call out for Umpire Hartley
an easy four, Bell switches it off his hips through fine leg
width outside off, some swing away and Bell gets hold of it with a work behind point on the up, a hard hit
more width outside off and more swing, this time he touches it out to point
comes outside off, drives past one of the men at cover, the other one swishes behind him and picks it up
turned off the hips behind square now
gets behind the line of the ball and there's a controlled edge behind point
bangs it in short and that's nearly calamitous! The ball goes high off the top of the bat and three men are in the vicinity of midwicket, but Fulton can't quite get there in time
pushed off the legs in between midwicket and mid on
driven hard into his foot, that's got to hurt
nipped in from outside off, pitched up and Wright makes no mistake in boshing that one past Gillespie, nearly taking him out, and on the way hard through mid off
goes for a huge pull now but it goes straight behind McCullum - not quite where he intended it to go - and the slog bounces two or three times before hitting the rope
he certainly intended this one, Wright crashing a pull through midwicket with plenty of power this time
on off, flicked away nicely with some pure timing on the front foot which goes cleanly up and over, between mid on and middle. Top drawer
slower ball, a hint of dip, driven out through mid on and shoddy from Taylor who lets it go through. New Zealand's heads are down
tries the dipper again, pushed out to mid on and it could be tight, the underarm shy would probably have dismissed Wright there
strayed on to the legs, flicked out to midwicket
slower ball again, full toss, driven hard through the covers, good placement there, Wright coming right out of his crease with the drive
down the track and not a great shot from Wright, a mistimed pull that goes straight but they collect an overthrow in the process
fully pitched up outside off, Wright's over it and squeezes it down to third man. That was his slower ball
overpitched and Wright makes the most of it, down on one knee and Wright drives back over the bowler off the bse of his bat and he doesn't even bother to leave his crease
short ball, Wright on his knee and pulls hard out to long on, the catch taken by Gillespie with palms up
nipped back in from just outside off, forces the defensive and McCullum shouts immediately "Yes, that's the length, lads." How a wicket can change the mood
outside off, driven on the front foot to the covers where the ball's quickly snapped
outside off, some movement away, and cut hard to the covers, straight to the man there
great start, beating the outside edge with flight and turn, and McCullum's quick hands whip off the bails
on the legs, Pietersen swishes round
cut off the back foot into the covers
dropped! Vettori just tipped that one over the bar as Pietersen scoops up to the leg side and it should have been caught but Vettori's lone hand parried it up
pushed out to mid off
comes down with a big stride and presses forward with an exaggerated defence
on middle and leg and driven out to mid on
on the front foot in line with off, defended hard right over the ball
Pietersen backs away so much for a second I thought he'd pulled out of it, but no, the bowler delivers and he cuts out to the covers
oh, tempted into a drive away from the body, but nearly gets the edge
low full toss and Pietersen's arms are ready for the drive but he pushes out to mid on
right up there on off, defended forward
floated on to the legs, driven out in front of midwicket
backs away and Bell drives inside out with a fluid cover drive that is timed all the way to the rope
pushed into the pads, Bell pushes forward to the leg side and they decide not to run
a sturdy defence on the front foot
on the legs, pushed out to square leg
pushed up there on middle, and defended hard on the front foot
another well-struck shot from Bell, driven straight back over the umpire's head
outside off, a hint of rise, and worked off the back foot to third man
steps back and then steps forward into the push back towards the bowler
full toss and Pietersen drives hard at it, there's a touch of a mistime, and a touch of a misfield too, Vettori allowing them back for two by diving right over it
on the front foot, drives hard through the extra-cover region
slower ball, driven out square to point
pushed with a little too much bottom hand towards mid-on,  in the air longer than the batsman would have wanted
looks to sweep, it's short, so he paddles from head height to long leg
back, waits, and turns round the corner for a strolled single
powerfully swept to deep backward square leg who fumbles as he fields
no pace, pulled from outside off stump to deep square
KP shimmies to the off to sweep, Styris follows, Pietersen leaves as it's outside off even with him standing where he is and the umpire calls a rather harsh wide
pushed to point
Bell crouchingly defends into the off side
checked drive back to the bowler
straight drive over long-on ... he was teeing up for that
clipped through midwicket, superb placement gets him two even though he hardly hit it
skips down and thumps that towards wide long-on, it bounces two thirds of the way to the man in the deep
driven into the covers where there's a man back
stands tall and cracks the ball square on the off side, Mills makes a good stop diving to his left on the run right out on the rope
all-bottom-handed swish square on the leg side
back and punched to longish-on
that sums it up ... a thick edge cut into his pads and it evades the keeper and goes behind him. When it's not your day ...
flicked into the on side
predetermined sweep, it goes high but far too fine for any fielder, near or far, to be able to cut it off
mistimed backfoot drive to extra cover
fuller, square driven and a good tumbling stop by Marshall at point
he brings up his fifty with a classical on drive
almost disdainful pull, well stopped by a sprawling How on the square-leg boundary
a rare mistake, missing as he looks to flick to leg and the ball drops into the off side from the pad
unorthodox - but with KP what else do you expect - flick down to long-on
shapes to sweep, hits his pad but he is a country mile outside the off stump
this time he connects with the sweep, no real effort but it races across the rope as if fired from a rocket-launcher
one step, two step and a one-legged storkish swing over wide midwicket
fired in, pushed back from where it came
happy to take the single into a big space at midwicket
a rare semi victory to the bowler, he finds a thick edge which goes past slip along the ground and backward point mops up
inside out checked drive square on the off side
top stuff in any form of the game, a superb straight drive but the fielding is equal to it, an excellent flick back an inch inside the rope from Mason
the end is nigh ... Pietersen stands tall and pulls square with real va va voom
outside off and Pietersen puts his all into a pull ... and misses
yorker as he ambles to the off, he does well to dig it out into the on side
waist-high full toss, he can do no more than pat to short midwicket
back and hit hard to short extra cover
back but picks his spot out to deep cover
lollypop outside off, deep cover again fields
steered behind on the off side
cut to point
finally he gets what they have both been trying to do all over, a fine cut evades backward point and it races away
very solid defensive shot. He wants to end in style and not with a pokey single
a swing but not timed, a bottomish edge, midwicket fields
short, pulled over midwicket and the crowd erupts even before the ball is halfway to the rope. The players shake hands but it's been a one-sided affair.
